intro: Galium hellenicum, commonly known as Greek bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Galium hellenicum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
